TopicTitle: Video Wednesday: HOCgaming returns to playing KSP

Articles.Content: <figure class="tmblr-full" data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480"><img data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480" src="https://40.media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_nq3uv2rF1m1rr2wit_540.jpg"/></figure><figure data-url="https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3Dv9Wrb4AL-uk" data-orig-height="304" data-orig-width="540" data-provider="youtube" class="tmblr-embed tmblr-full"><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/v9Wrb4AL-uk?feature=oembed" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="304" width="540"></iframe></figure><p>HOCgaming is back playing KSP. For those of you not familiar with HOC, heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s made severral notable KSP series such as ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s No Mun Base and his Artificial Gravity exploits, that grew his channel to a follower count of over 100,000 people. He has also hosted two charity events around a KSP mission, raising tens of thousands of dollars for <a href="https://www.charitywater.org/"><b>Charity: Water</b></a>.<br/></p><p>All in all one can safely say that Harvey is a true mastodon in the KSP community, and weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re very happy to see him playing the game after a six month break. If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve followed him in the past or if youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re not following him yet then we can definitely recommend his channel.<br/></p>
Quoting what I said from the PS4 announcement, 'I never saw that one coming!'Ã¢â‚¬â€¹

After what he did to his channel with "The last project" and quitting KSP in the first place I don't think i'll be watching him again for a while.

It would still be cool if he did another charity project though.

Edited June 19, 2015 by Jon144
My, what an awful presenter. Worst vid I've seen in a long time.

All in all one can safely say that Harvey is a true mastodon in the KSP community,

So why are you showcasing him?

The Last Project was a burnout project. What did he expect? If anyone is looking for a good KSP series idea, simply start reviewing and showcasing popular craft published by users on kerbalx.com. Call it "This Week on Spacecraft Exhange" or something.

Harv is back. Yay!

I hope he does another thing for charity.

The Last Project was a burnout project. What did he expect? If anyone is looking for a good KSP series idea, simply start reviewing and showcasing popular craft published by users on kerbalx.com. Call it "This Week on Spacecraft Exchange" or something.

^That's actually a nice idea. I don't think people give much attention to video Wednesdays (compare the amount of replies with Devnote Tuesdays), a "This Week on Spacecraft Exchange" would be cool.
